cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming at southeast Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, near Plaquemines Parish (around Buras/Port Fourchon)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Sabine Pass, TX to the Alabama/Florida border including Vermilion Bay, Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (≥70%) of tropical-storm-force winds with increasing chance (≈20–25%) of hurricane-force winds as Ida nears landfall; gusts could exceed 100 mph if the storm attains major-hurricane status.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 7–11 ft possible along Plaquemines Parish coast, especially east of the landfall point and inside the Mississippi River delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain with isolated totals to 20 inches possible, producing considerable flash and river flooding in and around the port district.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas, large battering waves, and long-period swells creating hazardous navigation conditions; rip currents, reduced visibility, and possible debris impacts to channels.
